title: NPR Paul Reubens interview (AKA Pee Wee Herman)
body: <p><a href="http://www.npr.org/rundowns/rundown.php?prgId=13&amp;prgDate=29-Nov-2004" title="NPR's Paul Reubens interview (AKA Pee Wee Herman)">NPR</a> interviewed <a href="http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0000607/" title="IMDB - Paul Reubens">Paul Reubens</a> recently on their Fresh Air program. Here's their summary: </p><blockquote>The complete 45-episode series of the TV show Pee-Wee's Playhouse is now out on DVD. Reubens originally created the Pee-Wee character at the Los Angeles improv group called The Groundlings. Pee-Wee's Playhouse went on the air in 1986. It ran on CBS for 5 years, garnering 22 Emmys.</blockquote><p>Even though it's NPR there's still a KS or two.</p>
bodyArticleHtml:
2004-11-30

NPR Paul Reubens interview (AKA Pee Wee Herman)
